pageContext.claim: “[Biden says] 'We're going to close down all our factories. We're going to go with wind." Wind. Wind is going to be the answer. Kills all our birds, everything else.”
pageContext.analysis: Researchers have looked into this question and found the opposite -- wind turbines do not kill birds to any significant degree, perhaps 140,000 to 328,000 a year, according to the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service. By contrast, more than a billion birds are estimated to be killed by cats every year, and millions more are lost to vehicles, electric lines and buildings.
